content.title: Second-Look Laparotomy
content.definition: Planned reoperative abdominal exploration performed 24-48 hours after initial surgery for mesenteric ischemia to reassess bowel viability and resect any additional non-viable intestine.

basis: Initial bowel viability assessment may be inaccurate
Demarcation of viable/non-viable becomes clearer over time
Prevents massive resection based on uncertain viability

absolute: Questionable bowel viability at initial operation

technique.closure: Primary closure if bowel healthy; temporary closure if ongoing concerns

content.statement: Second-Look Laparotomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

clinical_pearls: When in doubt, plan a second-look
Up to 40% will need additional resection
